conclusion: Calculate the power of the external force doing work to keep the conductor rod OC rotating uniformly with angular velocity œâ.
The conductor rod OC rotates in a uniform magnetic field B.
The rotation causes a change in the magnetic flux through the semi-circular frame, inducing an EMF in the circuit.
The area swept by the conductor rod OC as it rotates is a sector of a circle with area A = (Œ∏/2) r^2.
The magnetic flux through this area is Œ¶ = B (Œ∏/2) r^2.
The rate of change of magnetic flux is dŒ¶/dt = B (r^2/2) œâ.
The induced EMF in the circuit is ùìî = B (r^2/2) œâ.
The current in the circuit is I = (B r^2 œâ)/(2R).
The current I flowing through the conductor rod OC in the magnetic field B experiences a magnetic force F = I r B.
The magnetic force is F = (B^2 r^3 œâ)/(2R).
The torque due to the magnetic force is œÑ = (B^2 r^4 œâ)/(2R).
The power of the external force is P = (B^2 r^4 œâ^2)/(2R).
